p: Reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) is the recommended method for the confirmation of a COVID-19 infection, using upper respiratory specimens (nasopharyngeal and/or pharyngeal swabs) or, if they can be obtained, lower respiratory specimens [ 20, 21]. High viral load from the nasopharynx was reported in an infant and remained positive for up to 16 days [ 22].
